DOC.brief_summary: Studies have shown conflicting results of the effect of exercise on dementia patients. The aim of this study is to examine the role of physical activity on the risk of cognitive impairment and dementia in older persons. To promote the benefits of aerobic exercise on dementia patients and encourage exercise prescription in the management of dementia subjects.
DOC.brief_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial on the Effect of Exercise on Physical, Cognitive and Affective Function in Dementia Subjects
DOC.criteria: MMSE<26 Age >60 Community dwelling and ambulatory Have a caregiver that is willing to participate and escort patient to hospital for training and assessment MMSE<10 live in old age home poor mobility, unable to attend exercise training no carer to bring patient to attend hospital training
